Hi,

I checked out some styles using visualstatemanager.

Using WPF Themes I checked out some of the styles.
There are styles where thumbs have a mouse over animation. And there are some which do not have it.

A closer inspection showed that styles where the thumbs have animation are "trigger based".
Or opposite: all styles using VSM (like RainierOrange or Daves-Glossy for an example) do not have animation on thumbs.

Any idea why the thumb states do not work?

Thanks in advance

Manfred

Hi,

I know pushing is not what should be done - but this is a problem and it would be nice if someone could say anything about it.

If this is a bug - or "expected limited functionality" - or whatever.

As a more common question: is VSM only supporting a part of the controls - and if so, will this stay like this or getting changed in the near future?

Manfred
